column4: Hello everybody. My audio just quit working, and I was wondering where I would start looking to get information on why it may have stopped. I'm using 12.04 if that helps any.
alsamixer
I feel a bit silly now. I don't know why I didn't think about that. Thanks.
I figured I'd give you a screenshot. I can see you're helping somebody else atm, so I'll wait until you're finished. http://img195.imageshack.us/img195/6512/alsap.png
Thanks for the tip. It's working now. I feel a bit like an idiot, but I haven't had problems in so long, I forgot how to fix things :/
NP
play /usr/share/sounds/alsa/Front_Center.wav 2>&1 |pastebinit

so when you play  /usr/share/sounds/alsa/*  you can hear all the audio files playing through the speakers?  I thought you were having an audion problem.  I guess I have no idea what we were working on here.
So when you issue command "play  /usr/share/sounds/alsa/*" ,   you do NOT hear any sounds?
And that is the issue that you are trying to solve?
uninstall pulseaudio  I guess.  I don't think that's it but won't hurt to find out.
did you uninstall pulseaudio?
Did you uninstall pulseaudio?
just uninstall pulseaudio
sudo apt-get remove pulseaudio  #And see if it solves your problem.
I doubt that it will  solve anything, but one thing is for sure;  If you don't do anything, you won't fix anything.
I gave you one thing to do.
Very good.
Whasamatter?
That is probably because it was part of pulseaudio.  Just use a different mixer.
alsamixergui
